Expect strong hard edged thermals with bullet cores, strong sink and most likely blue sky.
Expect softer thermals with cumulus cloud development. Should be pleasant to fly, head for base and follow the clouds!
Not likely possible for big XC distance. Warm moist stable air is thick and soup like, thermals canâ€™t move through it well.
May be turbulent! Hard edged thermals with strong micro cores. Weak lifts gets blown away and expect descent turbulence.
Windy unstable day. Possibility for cloud street formation.
Good morning! Later you will get your info. First thing is coffee!
Search wide and slow covering as much ground as possible with the best sink rate. Thermal will trigger on the most heated sources and fly over the mountain peaks.
Thermals will trigger on slightest change in terrain. Usually best and strongest thermals are away from the mountain.
Try to search for very good heated source on day like this and hope that there will be any lift.
Search downwind of any good heated source on the ground. Towns and villages works good on a blue day.
The best lift you will find on the upwind side of the cloud. If you are low, then search downwind from heated source on the ground.
Search for perfect spot to drink your coffee.
Search for cold beer. Why not?
When you hit micro cores crank hard and tight as possible. You might get half turn in lift, but for sure you can climb like this. Fight for every meter and never give up!
Don\'t turn immediately, relax and feel the glider. Listen to your vario and work your 360 turns.
Try to listen your vario and hang for any climb rate you get.
Stronger cores punch trough and stay upwind. That is your goal, center your 360s on the upwind side of thermals.
Find the strongest lift by working the upwind side of the thermal.
Good morning! Later you will get your info. First thing is coffee!
